column3: nits aside, I tested and ran gitian build for 0.13.0 osx using the result and got the same matches as with my Mac extracted version as well as the 0.13.0 release.\n
Concept ACK, nice!\n

Nice indeed!
utACK
Just out of curiosity: is the resulting file deterministic?
@laanwj As of [the changes made here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8617#discussion_r76523983) the file is deterministic, yes.\n
Nice!\nConceptACK / utACK\n
Concept ACK\n
Woohoo!\n

Maybe it's worth mentioning the dependencies for the script here (or in the comments of the script)

sudo apt-get install sleuthkit p7zip-full
That's Debian/Ubuntu specific...?\n
rogue space intent\n
Yes.\n
any reason not to `rm -rf MacOSX10.11.sdk 5.hfs`? it's not like we need them.\n
Not rogue: this is the target of the previous line's pipe.\n
rm -rf is scary? :)\n
Is it possible to specify this by name rather than by inode? That would make the script more future proof.\n

Using the tricks here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v0.13.0/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml#L144\nyou could make the tar and tgz deterministic. That may be useful for people to compare their results?\n
I didn't see an easy way to do so. We'd have to iterate through each subdirectory's inode manually I think. Either that or go recursive from the root and filter, but that'd be much slower.\n

```
$ ifind -n Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.11.sdk 5.hfs 
154283
```
Thanks, adding this.\n

```
83c01f4e834e44a1b0f7208ed56fcf86c6d336290dbc4f4d625903b4bbbe9ece  1.tgz
83c01f4e834e44a1b0f7208ed56fcf86c6d336290dbc4f4d625903b4bbbe9ece  MacOSX10.11.sdk.tar.gz
```
Given that elsewhere we also list Debian-style package names for dependencies, I think that's acceptable.\n
Added to the doc, along with a rm command to cleanup.\n
